meanings.sent1: The brave knight exterminated the dragon with his sword.
meanings.sent2: The pest control company exterminated all the ants in the house.
meanings.sent3: The superhero exterminated the villain's evil plans with a single blow.
meanings.sent4: The virus spread so quickly that it almost exterminated the entire population.
meanings.sent5: The wildfire raged through the forest, leaving nothing but ashes in its wake, as if it had exterminated all life.

meanings.sent1: The maid exterminated the stubborn stain from the carpet.
meanings.sent2: The new vacuum cleaner was able to exterminate all the dust mites in the mattress.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to exterminate the rabbit from the hat and make it reappear elsewhere.
meanings.sent4: The detective was determined to exterminate all doubts about the suspect's alibi.
meanings.sent5: The gardener used a special spray to exterminate the weeds in the flower bed, leaving it pristine.

meanings.sent1: The deadly disease threatened to exterminate the entire village.
meanings.sent2: The invasive species was exterminated to protect the native plants.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that his bad puns could exterminate the audience's sense of humor.
meanings.sent4: The evil sorcerer's curse seemed to exterminate all hope from the kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The ancient curse was said to exterminate anyone who dared to enter the forbidden tomb.
